master_is_stable.symptom: The cluster has a stable master node

shards_availability.symptom: This cluster has 1 unavailable primary shard, 19 unavailable replica shards.

impacts.description: Cannot add data to 1 index [.fleet-actions-7]. Searches might return incomplete results.

Searches might be slower than usual. Fewer redundant copies of the data exist on 19 indices [.ds-logs-elastic_agent-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-logs-elastic_agent.filebeat-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-logs-elastic_agent.fleet_server-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-logs-elastic_agent.metricbeat-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-metrics-elastic_agent.elastic_agent-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-metrics-elastic_agent.filebeat-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-metrics-elastic_agent.fleet_server-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-metrics-elastic_agent.metricbeat-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-metrics-system.cpu-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-metrics-system.diskio-default-2022.11.25-000001, ...].

diagnosis.cause: Elasticsearch isn't allowed to allocate some shards from these indices to any of the nodes in the desired data tier because there are not enough nodes in the [data_hot] tier to allocate each shard copy on a different node.
diagnosis.action: Increase the number of nodes in this tier or decrease the number of replica shards in the affected indices.

diagnosis.cause: Elasticsearch isn't allowed to allocate some shards from these indices to any of the nodes in the cluster.
diagnosis.action: Diagnose the issue by calling the allocation explain API for an index [GET _cluster/allocation/explain]. Choose a node to which you expect a shard to be allocated, find this node in the node-by-node explanation, and address the reasons which prevent Elasticsearch from allocating the shard.

disk.symptom: 33 indices are not allowed to be updated. 1 node is out of disk or running low on disk space.

impacts.description: Cannot insert or update documents in the affected indices [.kibana_security_session_1, .security-7, .kibana_8.5.0_001, .kibana_task_manager_8.5.0_001, .apm-agent-configuration, .apm-custom-link, .ds-.logs-deprecation.elasticsearch-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-ilm-history-5-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-logs-elastic_agent-default-2022.11.25-000001, .ds-logs-elastic_agent.filebeat-default-2022.11.25-000001, ...].
The [ingest, ml, remote_cluster_client, transform] functionality might be impaired.

diagnosis.cause: 33 indices reside on nodes that have run or are likely to run out of disk space, this can temporarily disable writing on these indices.
diagnosis.action: Enable autoscaling (if applicable), add disk capacity or free up disk space to resolve this. If you have already taken action please wait for the rebalancing to complete.

slm.symptom: No Snapshot Lifecycle Management policies configured
